title: Reduces age to 16 for eligibility to take GED
summary: Reduces the age to sixteen for eligibility to take the general educational development exam.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3737

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 27, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. CAMARA, CLARK -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A.
         HOOPER -- read once and referred to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation  to  authorizing  certain
         students  to  take  the  general education development test at sixteen
         years of age

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  2  of  section  3205 of the education law is
    2  amended by adding a new paragraph d to read as follows:
    3    D. A MINOR WITH A COMMITMENT LETTER  FROM  AN  ACCREDITED  COLLEGE  OR
    4  UNIVERSITY SHALL BE ELIGIBLE TO TAKE THE GENERAL EDUCATIONAL DEVELOPMENT
    5  EXAM  AT  THE  EARLIEST  DATE  THE  EXAM  IS  OFFERED AFTER SUCH MINOR'S
    6  SIXTEENTH BIRTHDAY.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04165-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to authorizing certain students to take the general education development test at sixteen years of age
